one_liner: A transformer-based model for high-quality defect detection in digitally printed fabrics.
how_it_works: Improved RT-DETR leverages a transformer architecture to analyze the relationships between different regions of fabric images. By focusing on global context rather than just local features, it enhances the detection of defects in complex patterns. The model processes high-resolution images, classifying regions as defective or non-defective based on learned patterns from a custom dataset of labeled defects.

steps: 2. Divide the images into regions for analysis.
3. Apply the RT-DETR model to identify relationships between regions.
4. Classify regions as either defect or non-defect based on learned patterns.
5. Post-process the results to highlight detected defects.
algorithm.core_equation: output = classify(region) where region is derived from the relationships identified by the model
algorithm.input_format: High-resolution images of digitally printed fabrics (e.g., 1024x1024 pixels)
algorithm.output_format: Annotated images indicating detected defects with bounding boxes

parameters.name: learning_rate
parameters.effect: A higher learning rate may speed up training but risks overshooting optimal weights.

parameters.name: batch_size
parameters.effect: Larger batch sizes can stabilize training but require more memory.

parameters.name: num_epochs
parameters.effect: More epochs can improve accuracy but may lead to overfitting.

complexity.time: O(n log n) for image processing depending on the number of regions
complexity.practical_note: Performance may vary based on image resolution and complexity.

use_when: You need to detect defects in fabrics with complex patterns.
Traditional methods fail to identify subtle inconsistencies.
High accuracy in defect detection is critical for quality control.
avoid_when: The fabric patterns are simple and easily distinguishable.
Real-time processing is not a requirement.
Resources for training a complex model are limited.
common_mistakes: Neglecting to preprocess images properly, leading to poor model performance.
Using an inappropriate learning rate that causes instability during training.
Failing to validate the model on a diverse dataset, resulting in overfitting.

strengths: High accuracy in detecting defects in complex patterns.
Ability to leverage global context for better classification.
Improved performance over traditional CNN-based models.
weaknesses: Requires significant computational resources for training.
Complexity may lead to longer training times.

compared_to.verdict: Use Improved RT-DETR for complex patterns; use CNNs for simpler tasks.
